title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
iMac 820-4668 No Power


Only FIRST LED showing up

PP12V_G3H = 12.05V
Replaced the SMC same behavior 

Power Rails as below 
PP12V_G3H = 12V 
PP12V_S5 = 12.05v 
pp5v_s5 = 5.1v 
PP3V3_S5 = 3.29V 
pp5v_s4 = 5.1v 
pp3v3_s4 = 3.29v 
pp12v_s0 = 12.05v 
PP1V2_S3 = 1.18V
pp3v3_s0 = 0v 
pp5v_s0 =0v


Replaced U8400 / U8440 / U8420 Still same behavior

When trying to turn on through the PSU injecting 12V on it. It goes to 0.180a and back to 0.049 and keep stuck at it

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing

Post U8500/600 voltages.

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
Check L7410 diode mode to ground.
Post U7400 voltages; pins 3, 13, 14.

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing

U7400

13 0

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
My error, 1V05_S0 requires 5V_S0 presence.

As per datasheet, U8500/600 don't have open-drain output, so pin 11 of U8500 MUST be high, when both inputs 12 & 13 are high at same time.
Post again their voltages.

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 72803, member: 682"]
My error, 1V05_S0 requires 5V_S0 presence.

As per datasheet, U8500/600 don't have open-drain output, so pin 11 of U8500 MUST be high, when both inputs 12 & 13 are high at same time.
Post again their voltages.
[/QUOTE]


U8500
11  0.412
12  3.28
13  3.27
U8600
11  3.29
12  3.40
13  3.29

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
Replaced again and still 3.291 pin14 U8600 and 3.289 pin14 U8500.

Any other pin specific voltage are you looking

I am actually injecting 12V (2amps) directly into the PP12V_G3H to measure these rails since I am not able to do this with the boar assembled.

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
Is OK to inject 12V there.
But set the amp limit to max first.
I can't believe how many people still think that can adjust injecting current...

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
Still same result. The max on my PSU is 3A. I had an weird behavior I assemble back in the case and it tried three times to go to the fourth light

It light up the second one and the third one and the back to the only first one. It happened twice. 

Could it be the reball of my SMC?
It's the only one thing I am in doubt with

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
U8500/600 are both same 2 inputs AND gate.
If pins 12 & 13 are high, pin 11 MUST be high too.

BTW, get a better (more powerfull) lab power supply, or use original.

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
I just assemble it back and now I am back to first sympton. It turn on and works sometimes and another times it doesn[t work and only one light. So PSU is not a problem thats what I assume since it turn on and stay stable for sometime.

My SMC is good soldered and working

PP5V_S0 appeared back when working.

After some minutes its OFF again and it trys to light up second light and it cannot it only blinks once. Really weird behavior actually I dont expect it to turn on out of nowhere. Btw it trys to turn on blinks second light and stay only on the first one.

But important to mention again I would disregard PSU, 5V_S0 line I guess its something which is causing the second light to blink and not stay stable.

Guess something PP3V3_S4 related

It should start with its original power supply.
If not, change it.

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message: Do you think the iMac PSU is faulty? or doesnt make sense? since sometimes it boots up to the system

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message: 12V/5A lab PSU supply can help you to discard possible power supply issue.

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
Mine is 35V/3A. 

Would you consider that the PSU of this iMac is BAD?

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
You are the only one who can confirm that.
But you need a proper lab PSU, or other known good original power supply.
Proper tools are needed to discard problems like this.

If you set your actual lab PSU to 3A, should be sufficient, but I'm not sure; no idea about a current profile on this board.

title: 820-4668 No POWER - PP5V_S0 missing
message:
Indeed

But with the tools that I have now and the behavior that happens. Sometimes it turns on and works and other it doesn´t (So I assume when working everything is working I mean all voltages / power rails).

I do think it could be a tiny component like a resistor not working properly and it all that we´ve got. But

Do you think it could be a PSU issue? If so I am going to be a brand new PSU for this iMac. but really hope to solve this problem
